svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
Feb 15, 2021" date: "2021-02-15"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet
* Options for controlling state size growth
* Using verkle tries for eth state
* A pay-for-storage model for evolving tree hashed data structures
* GetNodeData DHT approach to state availability
* Transaction gossip network for light clients
Proof of Stake
* Latest what’s new in eth2
* Latest eth2 call . Notes from Ben and Alex , discussion of what goes in the first
network upgrade, draft spec in the next couple weeks to turn off PoW
* chaind v0.2 , get data off your eth2 node
* 1 million in staking community grants from EF
* Adrian Sutton’s hard truths for eth stakers . Those truths didn’t seem that hard to
me.
* Dankrad: it’s important to go stateless
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Celer !
Celer is a coherent layer-2 scaling platform on Ethereum powered by Generalized State
Channel Network and Hybrid Rollup technology. Celer just launched cBridge , a
multi-chain network that enables instant, low-cost and ANY-to-ANY value transfers
within and across Ethereum’s layer-2 chains, Ethereum main chain and in the future,
other layer-1s, and layer-2 on top of those other layer-1 chains. Follow Celer on
twitter , blog , discord and telegram .
Stuff for developers
* solc-select v0.2 for easy switching between Solidity versions
* Remix IDE v0.10.10
* Intro to Solidity’s fuzzing approach
* Coding Roulette in Solidity tutorial
* Automatically verify your code with Sourcify
* Find the unit test failures in your code with Tarantula, implemented in a VScode
plugin
* Infura TX , autobump gas prices metarelayer, is live on mainnet
* Hardhat plugin to fetch the ABI for you
* Setup a vending machine that accepts crypto payments with Arduino device
Security/incidents
* Paradigm CTF solution writeups: Christoph Michel , Stephane , Ansgar Dietrichs
* yearn clone BT got hit for 1.5m with the same attack as last week’s yearn attack
* AlphaHomora 38m hack in a series of complicated transactions . If you were still
confused, check out Bartek Kiepuszewski’s explanation
* ArmorFi bug bounty exploit writeup , a mistaken hardcoded value
* Dedaub finds another no-source code exploit , this time in an arb bot with no checks
on who calls the function
* Flashbots and MEV over the last month. MEV-geth has 3-4% of hashrate
* Dependency confusion: successful supply chain attacks against BigTech. MetaMask’s
Lavamoat tools for sandboxing your dependencies
Ecosystem
* Check for claimable airdrops and POAP s
* Hackathon submissions from MarketMake and EthDenver , and the winners for MarketMake
and EthDenver
* Coingecko adds an easy way to get tokens into MetaMask
* Etherscan now shows the cost for standard types of transactions
* Secureum with more case studies to teach users how to read audits
* Although it’s long been clear that EIP1559 is the most popular EIP ever, there’s a
#SupportEIP1559 campaign
Enterprise
* “ Mastercard will start supporting select cryptocurrencies directly on our network ”
* Amazon had job listings up for digital payments in Mexico , but after it was reported
the job listings were removed
* BNYMellon developing a prototype for digital asset custody and administration.
Deutsche Bank getting into custody and prime brokerage
Application layer
* Colony v2 soft launches DAO platform
* synthetix’s $TSLA synth , and with afterhours trading on Balancer
* YAM doing ustonks on UMA , 10 synthetic stocks of r/WallStreetBets’s favorites
* mStable does a tokenized BTC basket , mBTC
* Contribute to clr.fund round 4; it's live , using MACI’s snark magic to hide who you
donate to
* themanymatts.lol : Matt Condon gives out NFTs to people who find the stickers he
leaves around the world or who meet him and hit the chip in his hand.
Regulation/business/tokens
* Mark Cuban: " ETH has an advantage over BTC as a store of value "
* St Louis Fed publishes DeFi overview and review
* People have been talking privately about how much MetaMask is making, Tom Schmidt
tweeted it . They’re sustainable.
* Simon dlr: exploring NFTs for authors , experimenting with NFTs for his novel
General
* Tim Swanson: Bitcoin and other proof of work coins are an environmental nightmare
* Matic rebrands as Polygon to implement Mihailo Bjelic’s EVM network vision
* GridPlus’s Lattice hardware wallet is back on sale ! And now with an affiliate
program - if you want to support this newsletter and haven’t yet bought the Ethereum
community’s hardware wallet, then click the link
Job Listing
* NEAR is looking for an EVM interoperability engineer
* Trail of Bits is looking for a technical editor/writer & security engineer
* 0x looking for devs of all types and a data analyst
Want your job listing here ? $250 per line (~75 character limit including spaces),
payable in ETH (or 250 DAI or 250 USDC) to evan.ethereum.eth. Questions?
thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum News ,” then
please put it on an Ethereum subreddit; emails/DMs are not part of my workflow.
Please click the following if you’re interested in sponsoring the newsletter .
Twitter: follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked are. Follow
@evan_van_ness to get most of the week's news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-feb-15-2021/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
* Feb 28 - Nimbus Grafana dashboard submissions due
* Mar 5 - Financial Cryptography DeFi academic workshop
* Apr 9 - May 14 - ETHGlobal’s Scaling Ethereum hackathon
* May 14 - papers due for WoSCA 2021
* Jul 20-22 - EthCC4 (Paris)
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
Week in Ethereum News
